intro: Quercus fokienensis, commonly known as the Fokien oak, is a species of deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall and its production of acorns. It typically grows in mountainous regions and prefers well-drained soils. Quercus fokienensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
